title: Revisiting the Christmas Narrative After My Deconversion!
description:
Everything has been quite a bit abnormal this year, I thought it might be cathartic to take some time to really understand this Christmas tradition that has been a part of many of our lives.

This year I will be celebrating without my Mom 
I don't think she cared about the religious aspect of Christmas, but for her it was about treasuring her family and wanting to give her four kids more happiness than she herself had.
For me, Christmas is about finding warmth and love- while it's beautiful, but also dark and cold outside. The religious aspect doesn't mean anything t
o me anymore, but the memories of our culture's evolution.
The tree is the main symbol of Christmas, yet it has nothing to do with Christianity.

It's my hope that we can evolve away from needing fake meaning and towards finding meaning in what we know is real, and truly ours.
I think it might enrich the memories we have of experiencing Christmas as former Christians to understand what really was behind the Christmas Story.
That is, the narrative of Jesus' birth.

one thing ive learned through my research is It seems that many, if not all, Bible stories were written to push an author's propaganda and therefore we must suspect that it's popularity very well may be attributed to its usefulness in spreading propaganda more than it's historical accuracy or objective truth value.

Let's take another more mature look at these stories now that we're free from pressure to interpret it a certain way.



#nativitystory #deconstruction #bible #atheism #christmas #christianity

2:15 Christmas Story Authors
8:49 Luke's Narrative 
11:02 Don't Ask Questions 
15:50 Matthew's Narrative and Prophecy Fulfillments 
27:03 Contradictions
28:30 Closing Thoughts

title: I'm an Atheist!
My Deconversion Story: Realizing the Bible is an Etiological Myth
description:
One thing that began to strike me as I was deconverting from Christianity is how so much of the Bible made more sense as an etiological myth than as a historical account. 
An etiological myth is a story created to explain the origin or cause of something — such as a natural phenomenon, or a human custom.
The word comes from the Greek aitia (αἰτία), meaning “cause,” and logos (λόγος), meaning “account” or “story.” 
So an etiological myth is literally a “story of causes.”
Because humans are hardwired for cause and effect, when they didn't know the cause of something, they would often formulate a story to explain it.
This helped early people make sense of the world and to orient themselves within it. 
Instead of explaining things through natural laws or biology, they explained them through narrative and the actions of a God.
God served for them as a placeholder concept to account for the phenomena they observed in the universe.
For them, it turned chaos into a narrative that could be passed down through their culture to immediately convey the thoughts and values they wanted to transmit.
Through studying ancient people group's etiological myths we gain a great insight into their psychological needs at the time, 
what scientific questions were pressing to them, and what morals they wrestled with, as they strived to build their society.

#deconstruction  #atheist #exchristian #myth #mythology

title: Christianity's Problem of Suffering: C.S. Lewis and @InspiringPhilosophy
description:
Every generation inherits the same impossible question: If God is good, why does the world hurt so much? No doctrine has inspired more sermons, more justifications, or more silent doubt than the problem of suffering. From the battlefield to the hospital bed, from the cries of the hungry to the slow decay of nature itself, existence unfolds as if mercy were a rumor rather than a law. Yet billions still believe in a loving, intervening Creator — a being said to know every pain, possess every power, and will only good. It is this image of a tri-omni God — omniscient, omnipotent, omnibenevolent — that collapses under the weight of reality. For if such a being exists, then the world as it is cannot be explained; and if the world as it is, exists, then such a being cannot. This dissonance lies at the heart of faith — and it is here that Christianity’s most comforting claim becomes its deepest contradiction.

title: Christianity Has Failed Girls on Many Levels! Do Epstein Victims Matter?
description:
Today I'd like to focus on the specific harm that is done to young girls by a Christian society.
I feel it's worth focusing on now as Christianity isn't necessarily growing in numbers- but is growing in power.
Having grown up steeped in Evangelicalism, I do have a lot of firsthand experience to reflect upon.
Christianity claims to be a moral force, a sanctuary from the dangers of the world. 
But what if the true danger lies not outside its walls, but within? 
What if, instead of protecting young girls, it erodes their dignity by placing the brunt of the blame for humanities fall on their shoulders?
What if it chips away at their agency, and teaches them to see themselves only through the eyes of those who would control them?
This is the reality I lived for many years, and Countless girls are still living it. 
And when Christianity must choose between preserving its power or protecting a young girl, it tends to choose the preservation of its own power.
This video is for my daughter, and For the young girl I once was—whose agency was denied, whose innocence was treated as currency, whose self-worth was tethered to obedience. 
And for every girl still being silenced, blamed, or sacrificed on the altar of religious power.
If we want a place where girls and women are truly loved and respected we have to create it ourselves, as it is not found through the Abrahamic religions.
Just as extreme Muslims have done when given power in Islamic Theocracies, American Evangelicals are trying to bring about a Christian theocracy and remove societal protection of women's independence.

#deconstruction  #deconversion #atheist  #christianity #exvangelical #exchristian #trump  #epsteinlist

title: Recovering From Christianity: Follow-up to "Viewing Christianity as an Addictive Drug"
description:
If you are drawn to an intense religion, that may be a red flag that you have some psychological work to do in order to meet your own needs in a beneficial way.
You may even be suffering from a neurotransmitter imbalance that is worth addressing, or maybe you've attached yourself to some ideas that aren't serving you well.
Because, I do believe that in a healthy and balanced mental state, the Christian message will be off-putting and should not resonate.
This isn't to say we don't benefit from humility and being able to acknowledge our flaws and challenges,
But to accept the Christian message of total depravity and that every inclination of our hearts is wicked should not feel right to our psyche- we should be able to sense that manipulation.

The church has become quite powerful in society and works hard to keep people in an unempowered and vulnerable state.
How we feel about ourselves is also a large determinant of how we feel about others, so a broken, unreasonable view of ourselves can manifest as harm to self and others.
Likewise, if you are beginning to doubt the religion and are beginning to judge it by your own personal standards, I think that is a sign of personal growth.
Dealing with issues such as stress and anxiety properly, helps to lessen the need for escape through addictive drugs and reduces cravings for such.

Solving real-life problems I think is a huge antidote to the withdrawal of Christianity. also creativity, and expressing oneself.


#exvangelical #deconstruction #deconversion #atheist #dopamine #addictionrecovery

title: Evangelists Came To Comfort Me With Bible!
description:
A couple of Christian proselytizing men knocked on my door today and we got into a long discussion about the Bible and the harm it has been causing. 
They said surely people want to discuss all of the havoc we are seeing in the world and the country today.
At one point in the conversation one of them made the claim that the we are a Christian nation, and I said well that explains why so much of it is falling apart now and we are so divided. 
I warned him how the Bible is a dangerous book, and that's when the other man said "but look how amazing and beautiful this world is.  Isn't it ungrateful for you to not recognize God and worship him for it?"
I told them there is nothing tying together all of this (pan) with the Bible. There is no legitimate reason to believe whoever wrote the Bible also created all of this. 

There are many holy books making the same claim, yet none of them actually have evidence of their claim so they demand faith.
But faith leads us with no way to determine truth other than feelings impacted by cultural influence.

And since this world is so fascinating and in many ways beautiful, majestic, seemingly authoritative in the way it can destroy lives with a storm or a famine, makes it all the more important for us to attribute it to the correct source, even if it's just a process.

Of course when there is something really amazing, many are going to want to claim credit and demand praise for it.
It's up to us to decipher which claim is true.
And what sounds very suspicious is someone claiming they heard from the being who created this and he wants you to worship him and live your life for him, obey this hierarchy and vote this way and that everything good you feel is his invisible holy spirit.

Compared to seeing fossil and DNA evidence and being told we all emerged from a natural process, but maybe we don't know exactly what happened before that but we are willing to refine our understanding.

#atheist #deconstruction #exvangelical #deconversion #christianity #bible #Evangelizing

title: Viewing Christianity as an Addictive Drug
description:
More and more, I find it fitting—and even necessary—to view Christianity not as a path to truth, but as a socially accepted drug. 
Like addictive substances, it offers a sense of relief, belonging, and emotional high—particularly appealing to those already suffering psychologically. 
Just as opioids dull pain without solving its source, Christianity wraps spiritual-sounding language around deep emotional wounds, redirecting attention from the self and real issues to a glorified deity and of course, those who claim to represent it. 
The popular idea that we all have a “God-shaped hole” inside of us doesn’t actually address psychological distress—it exploits it. 
It primes vulnerable individuals to seek comfort not through self-understanding or healthy coping mechanisms, but through surrender to a system that first convinces them they’re broken.

Today we’ll explore the provocative theory put forth by Dr. John Hunter in his book *Manufacturing Mania*, 
which argues that Christianity manipulates the same neurochemical systems as recreational drugs—and, in some cases, 
mirrors the altered states of mania and delusion found in mental illness. 
We'll examine how religious highs, conversion experiences, and the euphoric boldness attributed to the “Holy Spirit” often resemble dopamine surges induced by substances like cocaine and meth, or the grandiosity found in manic episodes. 
We'll also look at how programs like Alcoholics Anonymous often swap one addiction for another—trading chemical highs for religious ecstasy, with Jesus as the new drug of choice.

seeing Christianity as a drug helps me wrap my head around what is going on in people and to see the nuance in how it's overall harmful, 
and vulnerable people get hooked on it to escape problems in reality- while it is also exploited by many to gain power and wealth. 
And it definitely helped me in understanding the feelings I had during praise and worship. which was the final thing I needed to deconstruct in my deconversion journey

Being done with religion is much like I imagine recovering from any addiction would feel, once you are freed from it's control over you, 
you look back and see how harmful it was and are able to reflect upon the highs without being fooled by them again. 
Now I know that the feeling of God's presence was merely chemicals in my brain- Perhaps God is just dopamine, after all.

#Neuroscience #addiction #mentalillness #mentalhealth #AlcoholicsAnonymous #Christianity #deconversion #deconstruction #atheism #drugs #religion #dopamine #cocaine #nicotine #meth #Exvangelical #Evangelical #exchristianity #philosophy 

@aDoseOfReason
@JoelReadsBible

title: My Deconversion: When A New Story Emerges Behind Christianity
description:
I had been told by pastors and apologists that Christianity is fully unique and other religions drew from Christianity, that's why we see many similarities.
I thought they had no reason to lie and I trusted what they said far more than those of the world who are deceived and just really want to turn people away from Christianity so that they can continue to sin.
Because of this impression I had, I never did look into the details of the timeline for when specific myths and religions had developed.
I was pleased with how much of a new, improved understanding I had so far as a result of my deep dive into Christianity so I figured I would take a look into these claims further just to confirm that Christianity was the original thought leader when it came to developing religions...

description:

it was once just an obscure political philosophy, but now we are having it forced upon us more quickly than we have been able to understand and work against it.
it's an idea in the marketplace of ideas that I believe will bring a type of Hell on earth, 
I want to help break down the vision of the Dark Enlightenment, point out its flaws, and expose the motivations behind those imposing it upon us.
Ultimately, it is the end result of manufactured fear.
How do you we convince a free people to give up their freedom? 
The most reliable method is through manufacturing perceived threats, and amplifying fear.

title: Breaking Our Will: The Illusion of Salvation
description:
One of the biggest flaws of the Gospel good news is that it doesn't save us from anything real.
Christian doctrine provides a story of Jesus in which he saves us from things that can't be demonstrated to exist, while neglecting to save us from anything that is objectively verifiable.
There are plenty of real issues that we could use help with. 
But the 'savior of the world' leaves us alone with all of our real issues such as wildfires, natural disasters, disease, famine, disabilities,  miscarriages, sudden infant death syndrome, etc.
Thus what we see is that people who are saved have life outcomes that are indistinguishable from those who have not been saved.
This begs the question, did Jesus really save us from anything?
And How useful is it to be forgiven for your sins by the God of Christianity?...


#deconstruction #christianity #salvation #atheist #agnostic #deconversion #exchristian

title: SHATTERED Dreams and Failed Prophets! The Book of Revelation
description:
If the Bible is to be taken as the word of God, 
Then through God's words to his major prophets, (Ezekiel, Isaiah, Zecheriah)
We see that God was completely unaware of any plans to have a Messiah come to be the final blood sacrifice for the atonement of our sins. 
Which is believed by many to be His grand plan, established from before the earth was formed. 
This is The very plan for Jesus to become a final blood sacrifice made for our sins, the Bible tells us this plan was established before the foundations of the world.
*Quote 1 Peter 1:19,20
"with the precious blood of Christ, a lamb without blemish or defect. He was chosen before the creation of the world, but was revealed in these last times for your sake."
I find his unawareness staggering. 
It's as if he was making things up as he goes along rather than working a grand plan that was devised before he laid put the foundations of the earth.
I'll explain my thoughts further by giving some background and context to what was going on with the Israelite people during the authorship of the Bible,
particularly when the key Messianic prophesies were being made.
As understanding the context of their lives at the time will help us to gain insight into the mindsets behind the prophecies.
Christianity later attempts to harmonize these prophecies with its own emerging beliefs.
It tries to establish the old testament and the new testament as one coherent book inspired by the same God,
Even though doing so required a lot of awkward workarounds that I find fascinating to observe and comprehend.
We'll also discuss the implications behind Yahweh's lack of awareness or insight into his own divine plan. 
One would expect a God to be aware of his own master plan...

title: My Deconversion Story: "God's Ways are Higher Than Our Ways!"
description:
My deconstruction from Evangelical Christianity was motivated by a desire to refine my beliefs and to get to know God, my creator, better. 
I was told that He loved me and he deeply desired a relationship with me, in fact that was supposed to be the entire purpose of my life.
This is the main spiel used to hook people 
Into Evangelical Christianity...that the creator of the universe deeply desired a relationship with you.
It's an appealing thought for many who want to feel sought after and loved.
But what I found was a wall with no way to get around. 
I learned that it was fundamentally impossible to know God more, 
Because any interesting or challenging question I stumbled upon was consistently met with "you can't expect to understand God, His ways are higher than our ways" and "all will be understood when you get to Heaven."
But I understood this was an impossible task, to have a relationship with a being that I couldn't know or understand. 

Today I'd like to discuss why this commonly used response didn't work on me during my deconstruction period, and why it isn't a valid answer to our deepest questions and concerns about Christianity.


#Deconstruction #Deconversion #Atheist #Exvangelical #Evangelical #calvinismo

title: What's with all of the Blood Sacrifice, God?? I have an answer!
description:
Christianity was part of the evolution away from the superstition of animal sacrifice for the Hebrew people. It served as a theological explanation that helped unite the Jews and Gentiles under Roman rule, who already viewed animal sacrifice as a barbaric practice. This just makes so much more sense as an explanation than that it was the plan of an objectively moral God from the very beginning. 

Why would God change his views on blood sacrifice so drastically that he was willing to have suffer a painful crucifixion, so they wouldn't have to do it anymore? He could have just made death not a requirement for forgiveness, from the beginning. Then the Hebrew people could have become more civilized even sooner. God missed an opportunity to show timeless, objective morals. Instead of being evidence of an objective morality, we witness the evolving subjective morality of the people.

#atheism #exvangelical #deconversion #deconstruction #christianity #buddhism #exchristian #sacrifice #guilt #judaism #yahweh

title: There is no free will, and why that is devastating to Christianity.
description:
We are free to do as we will, but we are not free to will what we will. 
We often have the freedom to act upon our own will, but we didn't create our wills and desires, and we didn't design the minds or environments which formed them.
Our brains are formed by compounding factors outside of our control, and our brain is the tool we use to make every decision.

The main point I make is that we can usually act up on our desires, and in that sense we feel like we have free will. But when you look further back to where our desires came from, we realize they all come from our subconscious mind which through evidence we see is clearly dependent on the physical state of our minds which was fully formed by factors outside of our control. Such as our early life environment and genetics. Thus, we can't truly blame or credit people for the way they turn out. And obviously, Christianity is based on fully blaming people for their beliefs and actions as if a deep moral shame can be warranted. Even through Christianity itself, we see that God has ultimately pre-ordained who will be saved and who will be severely punished.

The problem isn't that I'm lacking in faith. The problem is that the belief system they are offering is morally reprehensible, and unsupported by the evidence. title: Divine Prophecies Fulfilled?? My Deconversion Story: Entering Deconstruction Mode part 4
description:
The prophecies of his return have failed, and that's okay. 
We can carry on without a physically resurrected Jesus- 
only the lessons we choose to take from the stories of his life, whether he was myth or human.
Let us embrace the ideals that resonate with wisdom, 
and discard those that are relics of a more ignorant and barbaric era.


#exvangelical #isaiah53 #deconstruction #deconversion #atheist #christianity #prophecy

title: Objective  Morality- Do Atheists Steal Morality From the God of the Bible? Frank Turek Says Yes
description:
Frank Turek is wrong when he says Atheists have nothing to contribute to discussions on moral topics... Objective morality is ultimately just an illusion. Embracing the reality of subjectivity can lead to a more peaceful and cooperative society. Here, I aim to demonstrate that both religious and secular worldviews fail to provide a truly objective basis for morality, and that recognizing the subjective nature of moral values can help reduce conflict, foster negotiation, and support democratic principles.

#morality #atheist #atheism #deconstruction #deconversion  #christianity #exchristian #philosophy #subjective #objective #philosopher #frankturek #samharris

title: My Deconversion Story from Evangelical to Atheist: Part Two Finding My Own Mind
description:
Not utilizing one's analytical skill leaves a person vulnerable to all manner of being taken advantage of, 
and prevents them from living an intentional, and uniquely effective life. 
The belief system cut me off from having a healthy connection with the world and the people in it, a.k.a. reality,
As well as cutting me off from my inner voice, and being open to true introspection.
This led to poorer choices in just about every area of my life, from my physical health to my career and finances and everywhere in between.
In this video, I discuss how Evangelical Christianity accomplished this and how I was able to discover these connections on my own!

title: Random Reflections: Toxic Positivity promoted in Evangelical Christianity
description:
One harmful phenomenon I noticed within the church I grew up in was that 
the requirement to always have faith in God, and suppress your own thoughts, Doesn't allow one to embrace the negative aspects of their life since doing so would reflect poorly on God and the belief system itself. 
This mindset Leads to not being able to heal properly from devastating events, and it leads to toxic positivity.

title: MY DECONVERSION STORY: From Evangelical to Atheist! pt1
description: My Deconversion Story: From Evangelical to Atheist! pt1

title: Beliefs with Great Potential to Cause Harm Should Be Scrutinized
description: Faulty Beliefs Can Cause Great Harm, and Evangelical beliefs in particular have great potential to cause harm if they aren't true.

title: My Reaction to  Mike Winger "Everything Women can and can't do According to the Bible"
description:
Should we surrender all of the accumulated knowledge we have in modern times and just allow ancient, unverified texts to override our moral values and dictate the way we live our lives?  
Do women really not have anything of value to contribute to men outside of sex, homemaking and childrearing? Do you really want your daughters to get passed up for promotions to men every time because they aren't allowed to have authority over a man, and be completely dependent upon a person born with a penis in order to make a decent living?

title: Self Judgement Day: Unveiling your Meaning of Life
description: At some point, we may recognize that we are nearing the end of our journey through life. When that moment arrives, we must confront who we have become and reflect on how we have navigated the circumstances we were given. This moment of introspection resembles the concept of the day of judgment in Christian mythology, except in this scenario, the real judge will be your own inner critic.

title: Being Manipulated Into Religious Belief: Evading the need for evidence.
description: The major religions try to get us to believe through manipulative tactics, since strong logic and evidence are not available.

title: IS BELIEF IN GOD REALLY A MATTER OF MORALITY?
description:
This video calls into question the assumption that belief is a matter of morality, and therefore warrants moral judgement. Through the Christian belief system, the sole determinant of the quality of our afterlife depends on whether or not we believed in and accepted Jesus as the son of God. Those who disbelieve are considered filthy rags. Believers are seen as morally good, while apostates will be rightfully punished. But is this just a manipulation tactic to get people to believe something which doesn't have enough evidence in and of itself to warrant belief? We will take a closer look at what factors play into our beliefs, where the blame for genuine disbelief ultimately lies, and the implications on the Christian faith if it is found that belief is not a matter of morality.
beccayoley@gmail.com
